Articles.Content: In ksp version 1.5 my mods doesn't work anymore i deleted my mods and installd them for version 1.5 but still thay won't work can sombody help me with this problem the rest of ksp version 1.5 does work good

Which mods and how did you install/uninstall them? Manually or through CAKN?

A log file would be appreciated as well

Edited November 10, 2018 by 4x4cheesecake

@4x4cheesecakei did it most of the time with the steam map 

Edited November 10, 2018 by Kerbalsgreat.Cyren001

8 minutes ago, Kerbalsgreat.Cyren001 said:

@4x4cheesecakei did it most of the time with the steam map 

Uhm....steam doesn't provide any mods, just crafts and missions. There is the twitch/curse launcher which allows you to install mods but it doesn't work very well.

I would suggest to use CKAN instead, it is the most reliable tool to manage your mods and well supported.

To avoid any issues, check the content of the 'GameData' folder in your KSP install directory and delete everything except for 'Squad' and (if you got the DLC) 'SquadExpansion'.
Then, you can launch CKAN, select the mods you want to install, wait a little bit unitl everything is done and launch the game
@4x4cheesecake i did install mod in ksp 1.4.1 and it workt very good but in ksp 1.5 it didn't  but i have CKAN only how do i install it then

20 minutes ago, Kerbalsgreat.Cyren001 said:

@4x4cheesecake i did install mod in ksp 1.4.1 and it workt very good but in ksp 1.5 it didn't  but i have CKAN only how do i install it then

I'm not quiet sure what you are asking for but it sounds like that you don't know how to use CKAN, so let me explain it to you:

Once you started CKAN, you will see this window:

In this moment, CKAN displays a list of every mod which is compatible with your KSP version. On the top, right below the big 'Update' button, you can find a 'filter by name' textfield, which can be used to search for a mod.

For example: Let's say you want to install 'Kerbal Engineer Redux', you can  type 'Kerbal engin...' in the textfield and CKAN will filter the list by name:

CKAN will automatically select the latest mod version available for your KSP install, so all you have to do is to select the mod on the left side by clicking into the box in the 'installed' column:

This will mark this mod for installation and the 'Apply changes' button becomes available. Hit this button and CKAN will display a list of all mods that are going to be installed or uninstalled. In this case, it is just Kerbal Engineer Redux:

In the lower right corner, hit the 'Apply' button and CKAN will download and install the mod for you

 

If the mod you want to install requires another mod to run properly, CKAN will install the other mod automatically. Sometimes, other mods are listed as 'recommend' and these recommendations are presented to you between the last two steps but that's actually a nice feature

As soon as an Update for an installed mod becomes available, CKAN will notify you about it and a new box in the 'update' column becomes available. TO actually update the mod, just hit the box and the 'Add available updates' button becomes available.

i am playing ksp on a pc so it is harder couse  what i see in my CKAN map is History, installd-auto.ckan and RasterPropMonitor but not what you let me see

IIRC, RasterPropMonitor doesn't do anything on it's own and you need a to install an IVA view which uses this mod as well. Since the MK1-Pod got revamped, that's might be the issue here.

Which IVA view do you try to install?
I am not trying to install an IVA mod at this point i only wan't to install a few mods like Kw rocketry, Bluedogdesign, and an sls mod with rocket and satellite parts

3 minutes ago, Kerbalsgreat.Cyren001 said:

I am not trying to install an IVA mod at this point i only wan't to install a few mods like Kw rocketry, Bluedogdesign, and an sls mod with rocket and satellite parts

Well, I'm not quiet sure then if I understood your problem here

While KW rocketery already got updated for 1.5.1, the same doesn't apply to Bluedog Design Bureau. You can allow CKAN to install these mods anyway but there is no garantee that any of them will work properly.

To allow CKAN to install mods from a different KSP version, go to Settings -> Compatible KSP versions and set a checkmark for 1.4:

Save these settings and CKAN will also show you mods which aren't updated to 1.5.1 yet but like I already said: no garantee that these mods will work, you may have to wait for an update.

I got KSP on steam but I definitly got nothing called 'Squad map' or any other tool for mod installation...

Anyway, this doesn't lead us anywhere helpful, so let's go for the 'classic' solution: Please upload a log file, I have to see what's happening there. The log file should be located here: 

%USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\output_log.txt

Please do not copy&paste the content of the file here. Upload the whole file to a cloud or any other file hoster and share the download link.

1 hour ago, Kerbalsgreat.Cyren001 said:

the squad map stands in gamedata

The word you're looking for is folder. A map is something completely different. And no, mods don't belong in the Squad folder but in the GameData folder.
